byline.contributor: Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington
byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MARK LANDLER

abstract: Pres Obama, in first public response to Brexit vote, says special relationship between United States and Great Britain will continue and that European Union will remain important partner; acknowledges that exit highlights ongoing challenges of globalization; vote deals blow to Obama's vision of open and connected world.
lead_paragraph: The vote by Britons to leave the European Union threw a shadow over the technology-friendly president’s trip to the Global Entrepreneurship Summit at Stanford University.

headline.main: Obama Says ‘Special Relationship’ With Britain Will Endure
headline.print_headline: Obama Acknowledges Loss but Says ‘Special Relationship’ Will Continue

snippet: The vote by Britons to leave the European Union threw a shadow over the technology-friendly president’s trip to the Global Entrepreneurship Summit at Stanford University.
